algorithm_technique: Iterate through dimensions, calculate diagonal squared, find max diagonal, return corresponding area.
problem_summary_simple: Find the rectangle with the longest diagonal and return its area. If ties, return the largest area.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through rectangle dimensions, compute diagonal squared (l^2 + w^2), track max diagonal and its area.
key_insights: Diagonal length is proportional to the square root of (length^2 + width^2). Comparing squares avoids floating-point issues.
The problem can be solved by finding the maximum of a tuple (diagonal_squared, area) for each rectangle.
